item.title: Trump U-turn: Is Venezuelan oil really available to Cuba again?
item.content:encoded: The US says it will licence entities to sell the oil to Cuba except those linked to the Cuban government and military.

item.title: From Gaza to defence: Five key takeaways from Indian PM Modi’s Israel visit
item.content:encoded: Indian PM throws his weight behind Israel's Netanyahu even as genocide continues in occupied Palestinian territory.

item.title: Epstein and the politics of distraction
item.content:encoded: Scandal individualises corruption, creating a spectacle that redirects anger away from structural power.

item.title: Gaza mother recognises missing son on Israeli ‘for sale’ post
item.content:encoded: A mother from Gaza says she recognised her missing son listed as ‘for sale’ in a post shared by Israeli soldiers.

item.title: What is Greater Israel, and how popular is it among Israelis?
item.content:encoded: Recent US and Israeli comments on 'Greater Israel' trigger regional concerns over sovereignty and territorial expansion.

item.title: Kim Jong Un oversees massive Pyongyang military parade
item.content:encoded: Kim Jong Un oversaw a massive military parade in Pyongyang to wrap up the once every-five-years Workers' Party congress.

item.title: World Economic Forum head Borge Brende quits after Epstein links revealed
item.content:encoded: The World Economic Forum boss, a former Norwegian foreign minister, had dinners and exchanged messages with Epstein.

item.title: Has Trump’s trade strategy lost leverage?
item.content:encoded: A Supreme Court setback on tariffs challenges Trump's protectionist trade strategy.

item.title: Global impunity fuels Israel’s illegal push to annex West Bank: Amnesty
item.content:encoded: Rights group slams international failure to deter Israel’s escalating annexation, apartheid policies in the West Bank.

item.title: Who is really safe in India and Israel?
item.content:encoded: Not even all Hindus and Jews find safety in the countries supposedly built to protect them.

item.title: India-Israel axis: What are the IMEC corridor, I2U2 grouping Modi spoke of?
item.content:encoded: During his Knesset speech in Jerusalem, Modi mentioned multilateral projects on which India and Israel collaborate.

item.title: ElevenLabs CEO says voice AI will change everything. Can it be controlled?
item.content:encoded: From restoring speech to deepfakes, Mati Staniszewski talks about where voice AI crosses the line.

item.title: How Trump’s 2026 Iran ‘war’ script echoes and twists the 2003 Iraq playbook
item.content:encoded: Echoes of 2003: How Trump is using conflicting intel and homeland threats to justify a new escalation with Iran.

item.title: More than 1,000 UK councillors sign Palestine pledge as local polls loom
item.content:encoded: The campaign aims to pressure local authorities to divest from Israeli weapons manufacturers.

item.title: Cartels, Chaos & the 2026 World Cup
item.content:encoded: Cartels, Chaos & the 2026 World Cup

item.title: Israeli forces fired 900 bullets at Gaza medical convoy, new report reveals
item.content:encoded: A new report found that Israeli soldiers fired over 900 bullets at Palestinian aid workers in March 2025, killing 15.

item.title: Denmark’s PM Mette Frederiksen calls parliamentary election on March 24
item.content:encoded: Announcement comes as Frederiksen aims to build on rising support for her stance against US efforts to seize Greenland.

item.title: Video: Palestinians in Gaza overcome hardships to celebrate Ramadan
item.content:encoded: Ahmed Abu Naji is one of millions of Palestinians in Gaza who are clinging onto the traditions of Ramadan.

item.title: Cristiano Ronaldo buys 25 percent stake in Spanish second-tier club Almeria
item.content:encoded: Almeria, relegated from La Liga in 2023-24, had been under the control of Saudi owners for more than six years.

item.title: South Africa: A year after USAID cuts
item.content:encoded: Health workers and their patients are still reeling from the impact from last year.

item.title: Greek court finds 4 guilty in major 2022 spyware scandal
item.content:encoded: Two Greeks and two Israelis found guilty of 'breaching the confidentiality of telephone communications'.

item.title: The Royal Lodge: Epstein’s links to ex-Prince Andrew’s financial meetings
item.content:encoded: Emails reveal how Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor's royal home was site of financial meetings on which Epstein advised.

item.title: What to expect when the Clintons are questioned on Epstein links
item.content:encoded: Former US Secretary of State Hillary Clinton and former President Bill Clinton are to testify over Epstein.

item.title: Kenya arrests suspect in duping men to fight for Russia in Ukraine war
item.content:encoded: Arrest in Ethiopian border town follows Kenyan intelligence report of more than 1,000 citizens trafficked for war.

item.title: What to know about US-Iran nuclear talks in Geneva
item.content:encoded: Negotiators from Iran and the United States are holding a third round of indirect nuclear talks in Geneva, Switzerland.
